content.text: Find the value of p in the following questions, given that you know one possible solution

hint.text: Let us consider the equation 5x + 3y = p. If you are given that x = 2 and y = 3 is a solution, you can substitute x = 2 and y = 3 into the LHS (Left Hand Side) of the equation above and you find that 5x + 3y = (5 \(\times\) 2) + (3 \(\times\) 3) = 19 = RHS = p. Therefore, p = 19.
